Type.Name: Entry

TypeSignature.Value: public class Entry : Gtk.Widget, Gtk.ICellEditable, Gtk.IEditable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Entry extends Gtk.Widget implements class GLib.IWrapper, class Gtk.ICellEditable, class Gtk.IEditable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: An Entry is a single-line text entry widget.

remarks.para: This widget should be used to retrieve small amounts of text from the user. A fairly large set of key bindings are supported by default. If the entered text is longer than the allocation of the widget, the widget will scroll so that the cursor position is visible.
See also the widget for displaying and editing large amounts of text.

Docs.summary: Connect to this event to be notified when the user hits 'return'.

remarks.para: Connect to this event with a standard .

Docs.summary: Determine whether to activate the 'default widget' in the window when the return key is pressed.

value.para: if the default button will be activated, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If the value is , pressing Enter in the entry will activate the default widget for the window containing the entry. This usually means that the dialog box containing the entry will be closed, since the default widget is usually one of the dialog buttons.
(For experts: if the value is , the entry calls on the containing the entry, in the default handler for the event).

Docs.summary: The alignment for the contents of the entry
Docs.remarks:
This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the entry.
The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

Docs.summary: When the contents of the Entry change, this event is raised.
Connect to this event to be notified when the contents of the Entry are copied to the clipboard.

remarks.para: Connect to this event with a standard .

Docs.summary: Connect to this event to be notified when the user 'cuts' a selection in the Entry.
Docs.remarks: Connect to this event with a standard .

Docs.summary: Connect to this event to be notified when the clipboard contents are pasted into this Entry.

remarks.para: Connect to this event with a standard .

Docs.remarks: All further configuration of the completion mechanism is done on completion using the API.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyClipboard() cil managed

Docs.summary: Specific implementation of Gtk.Editable.CopyClipboard for the Entry widget.
The position of the cursor in the text of the Entry.

value.para: The current character of the cursor.

remarks.para: Use this property to manipulate the position of the cursor - it is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the widget. The value must be less than or equal to the number of characters in the widget. A value of -1 indicates that the position should be set after the last character in the entry. Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CutClipboard() cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies any selected text to the clipboard and deletes it from the entry.
Connect to this event to find out when text is deleted from the Entry by the user.

remarks.para: Data pertaining to this event is encapsulated in a .

Docs.summary: Specific implementation of Gtk.Editable.DeleteSelection for the Entry widget. Deletes the currently selected text from the Entry.

Whether or not this Entry is editable.

value.para: if this entry can be edited, otherwise.

remarks.para: Set this property to false if you need to stop input into an Entry widget. For displaying textual data, it is more normal to use a instead.

Docs.summary: Implements the EditingDone method of the interface.

Docs.param: The index of the first character to get, (zero-indexed).
The index of the character to retrieve up to.
Docs.summary: Specific implementation of Gtk.Editable.GetChars for the Entry widget.

returns.para: A string representing the characters from , up to, but not including . If is negative, then the the characters retrieved will be those characters from to the end of the text.

Docs.param: X offset output of the layout.
Y offset output of the layout.
Docs.summary: Obtains the position of the PangoLayout used to render text in the entry, in widget coordinates.
Docs.remarks:
Useful if you want to line up the text in an entry with some other text, e.g. when using the entry to implement editable cells in a sheet widget. -
Also useful to convert mouse events into coordinates inside the PangoLayout, e.g. to take some action if some part of the entry text is clicked.

Docs.summary: Whether or not this Entry should be surrounded by a 3D frame.
Docs.value: if a frame surrounds this Entry, otherwise

remarks.para: Unless there is a very specific reason for doing so, this property is best left to its default to ensure consistency in Entry widgets across applications.

Docs.summary: Add text to the entry just before .
The character to display when is
Docs.remarks: The is the character displayed in the entry in place of the actual characters of when is . The default invisible character is an asterisk ('*'). If you set this to 0, then no characters will be displayed at all.

Docs.summary: Implements the concrete version of Gtk.Editable.IsEditable, to determine if the text of the Entry can be edited.

value.para: true if the Entry is editable, false otherwise.

Docs.summary: Get the object used by this Entry for text layout.

value.para: The Pango.Layout used to render the text of this entry.

remarks.para: This property is read only.

Docs.summary: The maximum number of characters that can be placed in this Entry.

value.para: The maximum number of characters that can currently be set in this Entry.

remarks.para: This property can be useful for ensuring no more than a specific number of characters are put in an entry.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PasteClipboard() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes the contents of the clipboard to be pasted into the Entry at the current cursor position.
Raised when the popup handler needs to be filled with data.

remarks.para: Data pertaining to this event is encapsulated in a .

The cursor is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the widget. The value must be less than or equal to the number of characters in the widget. A value of -1 indicates that the position should be set after the last character in the entry. Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

Docs.summary: Connect to this event to be notified when text is inserted into the Entry.
Connect to this event to discover when the Overwrite state has been changed by the user. This is usually done by pressing the 'Insert' key on a keyboard.

remarks.para: Connect to this event with a standard .

Docs.summary: Indicates if pasted text is truncated to the first line.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnsetInvisibleChar() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determine whether to display characters entered, or whether to mask them.

value.para: true if characters are being displayed, false if they are being masked.

remarks.para: This property should be used to create entry widgets for sensitive data such as passwords.

Docs.summary: Implements the WidgetRemoved method of the interface. This will effectively destroy the Entry.
Changes the size request of the entry to be about the right size for characters.

remarks.para: Note that it changes the size request, the size can still be affected by how you pack the widget into containers. If n_chars is -1, the size reverts to the default entry size.

Docs.remarks:
Reversed for RTL layouts.
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0
